sen.j: 永禄（えいろく）は、日本の元号の一つ。
sen.e: Eiroku is one of the eras of Japan.
Eiroku is one of the eras of Japan.
Eiroku is one of the eras of Japan.

sen.j: 弘治 (日本)の後、元亀の前。
sen.e: It is after Koji (Japan) and before Genki.
It is after Koji (Japan) and before Genki.
It is after Koji (Japan) and before Genki.

sen.j: 1558年から1569年までの期間を指す。
sen.e: It points to the period from 1558 to 1569.
It points to the period from 1558 to 1569.
It points to the period from 1558 to 1569.

sen.j: この時代の天皇は正親町天皇。
sen.e: The Emperor of Japan at the time was Emperor Ogimachi.
The Emperor of Japan at the time was Emperor Ogimachi.
The Emperor of Japan at the time was Emperor Ogimachi.

sen.j: 室町幕府将軍は足利義輝、足利義栄、足利義昭。
sen.e: The Muromachi Bakufu Shogun were Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, and Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA.

tit.e: Changing the name of an era
Changing the name of an era
Changing the name of an era

sen.j: 弘治4年2月28日 (旧暦)（ユリウス暦1558年3月18日） 正親町天皇即位のため改元
sen.e: The name of the era was changed in March 18, 1558 due to the ascention of Emperor Ogimachi
The name of the era was changed in March 18, 1558 due to the ascension of Emperor Ogimachi
The name of the era was changed in March 18, 1558 due to the ascension of Emperor Ogimachi

sen.j: 永禄13年4月23日 (旧暦)（ユリウス暦1570年5月27日） 元亀に改元
sen.e: In May 27th, 1570 the name of the era was changed to Genki
In May 27th, 1570 the name of the era was changed to Genki
In May 27, 1570 the name of the era was changed to Genki.
sen.cmt: 日付表記修正ピリオド補足

sen.j: 『群書治要』の「保世持家、永全福禄者也」から。
sen.e: From '保世持家、永全福禄者也' in Gunshi-Chiyo.
sen.cmt: 元号の由来の漢文なので、日本語のままにしました。
sen.e: From '保世持家、永全福禄者也' in "Gunshi-Chiyo."

tit.j: 永禄期におきた出来事

sen.j: 3年5月19日 (旧暦)（1560年6月12日） - 桶狭間の戦い
sen.e: The battle of Okehazama occurred on June 12, 1560
The battle of Okehazama occurred on June 12, 1560
June 12, 1560: The battle of Okehazama occurred.
sen.cmt: 「年表」等の項目の表記方法に準拠しました。

sen.j: 5年夏（1562年） - 毛利氏の支援により南条氏・行松氏ら伯耆国国人衆、旧領を回復する
sen.e: 1562 - the Nanjo and Yukimatsu clans, along with the Kokujins, Hoki no kuni, recovered their previous lands thanks to the support of the Mori clan.
1562 - The Kokujins of Hoki no kuni such as the Nanjo and Yukimatsu clans, recovered their previous lands thanks to the support of the Mori clan.
sen.cmt: 伯耆国国人衆=南条氏・行松氏
sen.e: 1562: The Kokujins of Hoki no kuni such as the Nanjo and Yukimatsu clans, recovered their previous lands thanks to the support of the Mori clan.

sen.j: 6年4月3日 (旧暦)（1563年） - 湯所口の戦いで山名豊数率いる因幡国守護勢が武田高信の軍勢に敗れる
sen.e: 1563 - The Shugo group of Inaba-no-kuni lead by Toyokazu YAMANA lose to the military strength of Takanobu TAKEDA at the Battle of Yutokoroguchi.
1563 - The Shugo group of Inaba-no-kuni lead by Toyokazu YAMANA lose to the military strength of Takanobu TAKEDA at the Battle of Yutokoroguchi.
1563: The Shugo group of Inaba-no-kuni lead by Toyokazu YAMANA lose to the military strength of Takanobu TAKEDA at the Battle of Yutokoroguchi.

sen.j: 10年8月3日 (旧暦)（1567年8月3日） - 伊達政宗誕生
sen.e: August 3, 1567 - The birth of Masamune DATE.
August 3, 1567 - The birth of Masamune DATE.
